tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V2.1 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore a former chip shop in Cumbria, a one-bedroom flat in London and a plot of land in Greater Manchester(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Crimewatch Roadshow Live The work of the Metropolitan Police's moped crime unit and how they are tackling crime on two wheels. Plus, advice for football fans on avoiding World Cup ticket fraud(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A young boy falls from a clifftop on to a concrete sea defence, and two British adventurers find themselves trapped in the ice off Alaska as they cross the Bering Sea(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Brampton 13 Two married couples take up the challenge in Brampton, Cumbria, as they battle to find three items to make a profit at auction, with help from experts Anita Manning and David Harper. Tim Wonnacott hosts(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: The Upper Hand Daniel and Zara continue to bicker, while Al, Jimmi and Penny seem to be having far too much fun at work. A patient with a cut finger leaves Karen suspicious(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Compilation - Knighthayes 39 Revisiting some of the locations from the series, including Greenwich Royal Naval College, Althorp House in Northamptonshire, and Herstmonceux Castle, East Sussex(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Liphook Charlie, David and Harry face a challenge in Liphook, Hampshire, where a couple have a big garden and a daughter with her own ideas on what makes the perfect outdoor space(n)

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Ore Oduba in which contestants have to answer questions to get as far along a track as they can before a ball catches and passes them, ending their go(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jack accuses Keegan of stealing the money from the club and demands to know the names of the other people whose fingerprints were on the bottle. Kim goes to see Phil, convinced he knows Vincent's whereabouts after giving her a shoulder to cry on. Kush grows increasingly concerned about Carmel and pleads with her to talk to a counsellor. Ted gets more than he bargained for on a visit to the allotments(n)

programme.title: Britain's Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman presents the quarter-final of the culinary contest. For their first challenge, the home cooks have two-and-a-half hours to prepare a sharing feast with at least four dishes - and as ever the key is to ensure they bring their individual personalities to the table. The judges' favourites get to choose the key ingredients for the second task, coming up with squid and mackerel, and with a semi-final place at stake, the hopefuls put everything into their dishes. Those who do not cut the mustard face the cook-off, which this week requires them to follow a classic chicken recipe(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Monmouth Nick Knowles, his team and a group of volunteers are in Monmouth, Wales, to transform the family home of Charlotte, a mother recovering from a stroke that left her with brain damage, speech loss and partial paralysis. The current layout of her home makes it difficult for Charlotte to move around and have her physiotherapy treatment, so the team redesign the house to make things easier for her, her husband Rob and their children(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Reading, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience(n)

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and other guests take a look back at the past seven days' political and parliamentary developments(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 08/06/2018 Round-up of national and international news, presented by Steph McGovern and Jon Kay(n)

programme.title: Britain's Secret Charity Cheats
programme.desc: Kevin Duala investigates a conman who took advantage of donations made to survivors of the Grenfell Tower fire. Last in the series(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A basement flat in London's Peckham, and terraced houses in the Salford suburb of Cadishead and Maerdy in south Wales are all sold at auction. Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners to hear their plans to add value to their auction buys(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Crimewatch Roadshow Live Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley asking for viewers' help with unsolved cases, focussing on cases involving fraud committed against older people(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A retired policeman comes to the aid of a young man after his car careers off a ferry and sinks in the harbour, and a pilot evacuates his plane after a huge engine explosion(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Malvern/Leominster 10 Anita Manning presents from Malvern in Worcestershire, where Gary Pe and John Cameron are the experts assisting the two sides(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Stepping Up Penny takes the boys out for a drink, Alia has Tarks over for tea, and Daniel attempts to celebrate with Zara. Meanwhile, Sid's blind date takes an unexpected turn(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Dorset Jonnie Irwin helps a couple search for a property in Dorset on a budget of £650,000, and later visits an award-winning dairy farm putting the county's cheeses on the culinary map(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Birmingham 3 James Lewis and Thomas Plant search for items in Birmingham bearing the city's hallmark, and Paul Martin finds out about Matthew Boulton, father of the Industrial Revolution(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Newport Charlie Dimmock and the Rich Brothers meet a couple in Newport, Gwent, whose garden boasts dangerous sloped banks full of wild weeds, overgrown hedges and too many trees(n)

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Contestants answer questions to get as far as they can along a track before a ball catches and passes them, ending their go. Quiz, hosted by Ore Oduba. Last in the series(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: 08/06/2018 Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former England striker Michael Owen, ex-Chelsea Ladies forward Eniola Aluko, triple Olympic bronze medallist Kelly Sotherton and Ryder Cup golfer Chris Wood join regular team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sonia chastises an apologetic Martin for him and Stacey carrying on in secret, but she agrees not to tell anyone - unaware that Ted has already spread the word about their amorous allotment antics. Jack challenges Hunter over the missing money but Mel is quick to jump to her son's defence. Carmel is upset with Ian's plans for her campaign against knife crime, fearing it may stop people coming forward, and Denise suggests it may be time for Kim to contact the police regarding Vincent's disappearance(n)

programme.title: The Button
programme.desc: The final edition of this innovative game show set simultaneously in the houses of five UK families, which sees competitors tackle a number of fiendishly fun challenges requiring skill, determination and intellect from the comfort of their living rooms over the course of a day in the hope of securing cash prizes. Featuring the voice of Alex Horne. Last in the series(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents, as regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by one-time Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain, comic and actor Michael Smiley, and comedians Bob Mortimer and Diane Morgan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed the liar of the week(n)

programme.title: Tracey Breaks the News
programme.desc: Award-winning actress, impressionist and comedian Tracey Ullman reacts to the events of the moment. This instalment sees the return of Theresa May, Angela Merkel, Nicola Sturgeon and the ever-trustworthy Michael Gove. Plus, the love story between Rupert Murdoch and Jerry Hall continues, as does politics' most hapless double act - Jacob Rees-Mogg and his long-suffering Nanny. With Ben Miller and Liam Hourican(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Olympic and world champion sprinter Usain Bolt, who is set to take part in this year's Soccer Aid. Hollywood star Channing Tatum also graces the sofa to talk about his new stage show Magic Mike Live. Comedian and writer Jennifer Saunders and her actress daughter Beattie Edmondson discuss working together in Disney film Patrick, while Rob Brydon reflects on his role in the new comedy movie Swimming with Men. Plus, Florence and the Machine perform Hunger. Providing there's time, some more audience members will try to recount an anecdote from the red chair(n)

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites sports presenter Gabby Logan and comedians Richard Ayoade and Alun Cochrane to express their anger over people, events and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include people who laugh out loud when reading a book, half-and-half scarves - and fun(n)

programme.title: Britain's Secret Charity Cheats
programme.desc: Kevin Duala meets the former paratrooper taking on the bogus military charities collecting on our streets and finds out what benefits charity fundraising balls can bring(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Bourne Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich visit a sparse garden in the town of Bourne, Lincolnshire, whose owners Lizzie and Mike want the colours and feel of an island getaway(n)

programme.title: Love in the Countryside
programme.desc: Dairy farmer Ed is still unsure if he has found the one, so he travels to visit 29-year-old Lisa and 25-year-old Rebecca in each of their home towns. Meanwhile, 59-year-old pig farmer Wendy found herself drawn to former banker Paul and business man Simon, and when both men arrive on her farm, the competition heats up with both men vying for her heart. Elsewhere, Farrier Mark finds himself in a complicated situation when he admits that he is attracted to both of the women he invited to spend time with him in rural East Anglia(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 Jo Coburn and her guests discuss the latest parliamentary proceedings and what has been happening in the world of politics(n)

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at £1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their attempt, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game(n)

programme.title: For What It's Worth
programme.desc: Antiques expert Anita Manning joins host Fern Britton as three pairs of contestants answer questions in a bid to amass antiques and collectibles that can later be converted into cash(n)

programme.title: Ray Mears' Bushcraft
programme.desc: Jungle Trek Ray treks along a traditional Amazon jungle trading path, which runs in the shadow of incredible mountains called Tepui. En route, he finds spectacular waterfalls, clouds of butterflies and one of the most beautiful villages on Earth(n)

programme.title: Edwardian Farm
programme.desc: Spring sees the daffodil harvest, accompanied by a rush to get the flowers off to the train station so they can be delivered to towns and cities across the country within hours of being picked. Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn go to Dartmoor for the annual pony trek, and use the occasion to purchase one of the beasts for the farm. However, before their new pony is fit for work, he needs to be trained, and the farmers hire American horse whisperer Mike Branch for the job. Meanwhile, the arrival of new lambs is followed by a pleasant surprise for Ruth Goodman in the run-up to Mother's Day(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Auctioneer James Braxton and dealer Danny Sebastian go bargain-hunting at a car-boot sale in West Sussex, where items that catch their eyes include a set of scales and a barrel(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe, actor and writer Steve Pemberton and presenter Fern Britton continue the daily test of their skills. Hosted by Richard Osman(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Team captains Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke are joined by Christy Harrison and Vim Kumaratunga for another test of wildlife knowledge, hosted by Kate Humble(n)

programme.title: RHS Chatsworth Flower Show
programme.desc: Adam Frost, Carol Klein, Arit Anderson, Nick Bailey and Mark Lane present highlights from this year's RHS flower show at Chatsworth. They seek out horticultural inspiration and planting design ideas in the show gardens and floral marquee, discover why conifers could be coming back into fashion and explore Chatsworth's rich orchid history(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Springwatch 2018 Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are joined by guests Iolo Williams and Lucy Cooke at the National Trust's Sherborne Park in Gloucestershire to look back at another busy few days. Gillian Burke reports on a piece of massive mining machinery that was once the largest machine in the world, but since being mothballed has been colonised by all kinds of birds(n)

programme.title: Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Trap Kitchen and Greedy Khao Fred Sirieix meets the teams behind two more food concepts seeking money to start up their own restaurants. Trap Kitchen is a soul food-inspired takeaway from south London selling lobster tails, waffles, mac 'n' cheese and prawns in food boxes prepared in owner Prince's own sound London home, while Greedy Khao is a vegan Thai grab-and-go concept established by husband and wife Lee and Faai. Will the investors like what they see?(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: New series. Dara O Briain returns with a new run of the topical comedy show. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians James Acaster, Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Darren Harriott and Zoe Lyons. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis(n)

programme.title: The Secrets of Your Food
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 1/3(n)
programme.episode-num: Season 1 Episode 1/3|Michael Mosley and James Wong reveal the physics, chemistry and biology hidden inside various foods. In the opening episode they explore how this chemistry fuels and builds bodies, with Michael sampling most people's first meal - human breast milk, which contains important fats, carbohydrates, vitamins and minerals. Michael and James also unravel why sourdough bread is so beneficial, how the rice has become a comforting staple food, and why allowing mushrooms to `sunbathe' may help provide a welcome calcium boost <div class="other"> (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described)

programme.title: The Bridge
programme.desc: Still at large, Taariq spots the car used to kidnap Margrethe Thormod, and tracks down its owner with the intention of extorting money from him. When another murder at the hospital in Malmo appears to be connected to the two previous ones, Saga finally realises how they are linked and that the killing is probably set to continue. Meanwhile the girls vacate Henrik's house, and while trying to find them Henrik runs into Thomas, the drug dealer. Scandinavian crime drama, in Danish and Swedish, starring Sofia Helin and Thure Lindhardt(n)

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: Return of the award-winning documentary following the work of the West Midlands Ambulance Service. Call assessor Shanie, who has just graduated, guides a woman through childbirth over the phone, and a specialised mental health team is sent to help a man showing signs of agitation at a community centre. Meanwhile, a day shift takes an unexpected and very personal turn for paramedic Nat when a 999 call about an unconscious patient turns out to be referring to her teenage daughter, who has taken ill at school(n)

programme.title: Neanderthals: Meet Your Ancestors
programme.desc: Two-part documentary in which archaeologist Ella Al-Shamahi brings the prehistoric humans back to life with the help of actor Andy Serkis, the man behind computer generated characters in the Lord of the Rings and Planet of the Apes movies. Examining the fossilised remains of a Neanderthal, they are able to create an animated reconstruction, revealing that they were far closer to modern humans than previously thought and perfectly adapted to their environment(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The Natural World - Part Two Paul Martin and the show's experts examine valuable bird-related items, including a biscuit tin that grabs Thomas Plant's attention and raises a high price at auction(n)

programme.title: Britain's Secret Charity Cheats
programme.desc: An insider fraud that threatened a charity benefiting disabled children and a con that led to the demise of a lifeboat charity. Presented by Kevin Duala(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Liphook Charlie, David and Harry face a challenge in Liphook, Hampshire, where a couple have a big garden and a daughter with her own ideas on what makes the perfect outdoor space(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme pays a visit to the RHS Malvern Spring Festival to see this year's hottest garden designs and the season's must-have plants. Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Adam Frost explore the event, sampling the best from the floral marquee and show gardens. Meanwhile, at Longmeadow, Monty Don plants herbaceous perennials for summer colour and gives timely advice on how to care for carnivorous plants. Plus, Frances Tophill catches up with the growing trend for greening up indoor spaces with house plants(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: 08/06/2018 Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: 08/06/2018 A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: 08/06/2018 Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn(n)

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at £1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their attempt, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game(n)

programme.title: For What It's Worth
programme.desc: Antiques expert Kate Bliss joins host Fern Britton for the game show in which three pairs of contestants try to amass a valuable collection of antiques and collectibles by answering general knowledge questions, with the value of the items they win being converted to a cash prize(n)

programme.title: Ray Mears' Bushcraft
programme.desc: Africa Camp The survival expert joins the Hadza of Tanzania as he pays a return visit to Africa, sharing his love of bows, tracking and the landscape with true hunter-gatherers whose way of life demonstrates a profound connection to the natural world(n)

programme.title: Edwardian Farm
programme.desc: Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn set sail in an Edwardian trawler for a fishing trip, but as women were considered bad luck at sea, Ruth Goodman is left ashore to forage on the beach, prepare potted shrimp and build a smoke-house to cure mackerel. She also explores one of the growing fashions of the era by holding a seance, while once back on dry land, Alex and Peter drive their cattle along a dangerous route to find a new pasture(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian v James Braxton Showdown Danny Sebastian and James Braxton are challenged to take part in a showdown auction to determine which of them will be named the week's champion(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Arusha Irvine and Philip Serrell's challenge concludes in Gloucestershire as they take a Victorian marmalade cutter and a 16th-century bronze thimble to auction in Newent, Gloucestershire. Last in the series(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe, actor and writer Steve Pemberton and presenter Fern Britton take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Kate Humble hosts the panel show that tests the wildlife knowledge of team captains Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke and their guests Simon King and Dallas Campbell(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Monterey to Los Angeles Michael Portillo continues through southern California aboard the Coast Starlight rail service. In the port of Monterey, he discovers the city's Spanish and Mexican heritage, before heading to Paso de Robles, where he tours Hearst Castle, dream home of the newspaper baron, William Randolph Hearst. In the hills of Morro Bay, Michael joins avocado farmer, Jim Shanley, amid his 4,000 avocado trees to harvest the pears and learn how to make guacamole. Arriving in Los Angeles, Michael heads for the Warner Brothers studio, founded on Sunset Boulevard(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty Don finds places in his borders for bananas and dahlias, while in the vegetable garden courgettes and tomatoes are planted out. At RHS Chatsworth show in Derbyshire, Nick Bailey, Carol Klein and Joe Swift highlight the best of the plants and show gardens that the exhibitors have to offer. Adam Frost is in London where he offers tips on how to bring tiny garden spaces to life, and the programme reviews the finalists' gardens in our Every Space Counts competition and opens the vote(n)

programme.title: The Bridge
programme.desc: Taxi driver Dan Brolund, who was the last person to see Margrethe Thormod alive, turns out to also have connections to another victim. He is brought in for questioning, but at the same time suspicions about the Sonning couple grow. Saga feels she has come to a dead end investigating Henrik's missing children, and he slowly tries to face facts. Saga continues to attend therapy and after being given an assignment, realises that Henrik is the only person left in her life who means something to her. Scandinavian crime drama, in Danish and Swedish, starring Sofia Helin and Thure Lindhardt(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order
programme.desc: The comedian dissects the week's news using stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction. In order to assist in his quest, he calls on the help of regular contributor Sara Pascoe and a variety of other guests, including fellow comics and experts(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: 08/06/2018 Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark(n)

programme.title: Arctic Monkeys Live at the BBC
programme.desc: The rock band perform live at the Maida Vale studios, with tracks from their new album Tranquillity Base Hotel & Casino. Plus, classics from their back catalogue of anthems(n)

programme.title: Atlanta
programme.desc: Nobody Beats the Biebs A rival rapper steals the spotlight from Paper Boi at a charity basketball event, and Earn spots a chance to raise his professional profile when he is mistaken for someone else. Darius uses his free time to visit a shooting range(n)

programme.title: Atlanta
programme.desc: Value Van is irritated by her old friend Jayde, who is leading a much more successful life than she does. However, the pair find a way to put aside their differences while smoking weed - until Van remembers she is due a drug test at work(n)

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly(n)

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen(n)

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 The ladies put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and talk to US actress Gabourey Sidibe - the star of TV show Empire and award-winning movie Precious(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Doug confesses to Lachlan that he has sold his car to help raise money for Terry. Sarah refuses to make peace with Debbie, and blames Joe for leading her astray. Chas is thrown into panic when Paddy suggests they book another scan(n)

programme.title: Live International Football
programme.desc: England v Costa Rica England v Costa Rica . Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the friendly at Elland Road, as Gareth Southgate's men play their final match before the World Cup gets under way. The only previous match between the sides was in the group stage of the last World Cup four years ago, a 0-0 draw in what was essentially a dead rubber, as Costa Rica had already secured their place in the last 16 and England's hopes of progressing were over. This time around, the hosts will be looking to demonstrate how much they have improved as they look to build confidence and cohesion ahead of their opening fixture against Tunisia on June 18. With analysis from Lee Dixon and Ian Wright, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Glenn Hoddle(n)

programme.title: International Football Highlights
programme.desc: England v Costa Rica England v Costa Rica. Jacqui Oatley presents action from the friendly at Elland Road. This was the hosts' final match before their World Cup campaign got under way, and Gareth Southgate's team selection may have given an indicator as to who would start against Tunisia on June 18. With analysis from Glenn Hoddle and Lee Dixon, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley(n)

programme.title: Great Art
programme.desc: The Artist's Garden - American Impressionism Narrated by Gillian Anderson, The Artist's Garden: American Impressionism unravels the history of US artists who flocked to the French village of Giverny, home to the master impressionist Claude Monet, and cheered the French new wave - painting outdoors with a new found brilliance and vitality. They then took their new skills home and changed American art for ever. Presented by Tim Marlow. Last in the series(n)

programme.title: Give It a Year
programme.desc: Karren Brady meets a woman who overcame breast cancer and wants to open a hairdressing salon and spa, but finds her year delivers something very different. She also visits a Hoxton hipster who is brewing-up a new drink, and an injured sportsman who believes his method for teaching tennis could transform the game around the world(n)

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions(n)

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice(n)

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: 08/06/2018 A lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features(n)

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: 08/06/2018 Lorraine Kelly presents a topical mix of entertainment, discussion and showbiz glamour as well as the latest fashion, food and celebrity gossip(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice(n)

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: 08/06/2018 Celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen. Presented by Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford(n)

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Loose Women and Men Special: 08/06/2018 Guest panellists gear up for the weekend by engaging in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom(n)

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: Widnes David Dickinson and his team of antique experts arrive in Widnes, Cheshire, to broker some bargain deals. James Layte comforts an emotional seller, a man rings Cheryl Hakeney's bell and Mark Stevens is intent on acquiring some gold(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: The Chase for Soccer Aid Bradley Walsh presents as celebrities Kirsty Gallacher, Charley Boorman, Clive Tyldesley and Rachel Riley pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale (?)
programme.desc: The villagers say goodbye to Gerry. Diane becomes suspicious when Terry makes a hasty departure, and Graham gains the upper hand when Megan is accidentally locked in the toilet(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street (?)
programme.desc: Carla goads Alya over her handling of the MacNees order, leading to a furious clash between the pair of them, while Kate and Johnny clash over Aidan's funeral. Craig and Gemma join Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby on the This Morning sofa, and a glammed-up Rosie makes a late entrance for maximum effect. Continues at 8.30pm(n)

programme.title: Countrywise (?)
programme.desc: Countrywise: Guide to Britain Ben Fogle tries his hand at free diving in Cornwall and Liz Bonnin works with a team of volunteers at Cuan Wildlife Rescue centre in Shropshire caring for injured birds. Lesley Joseph indulges her love of stately homes as she turns guide for the day at Osterley Park in Middlesex and John Whaite travels back home to Lancashire and the family farm he grew up on to cook up some Eccles cakes(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street (?)
programme.desc: Carla confides in Michelle how she blames herself for Aidan's death, while Imran finds Aidan's will on the photocopier and stunned to see that he left the factory to Alya. Rosie reveals she's been offered a job in Japan, working on a TV game show, and Kirk is horrified when Sharon confesses she wanted to spend time alone with him(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon (?)
programme.desc: Frankie Comes to Hollywood After being unceremoniously dropped from the schedules to accommodate the Britain's Got Talent finals, Riggs and Murtaugh return to the seemingly crime-ridden streets of Los Angeles trying to unlock a case involving a veteran hitman who Murtaugh has followed for 17 years. The team members also find themselves wedged in a dangerous incident that tests their trust. On other fronts, Riggs struggles to find a connection with his father, and Murtaugh scares Riana with his overprotective driving lessons. Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans star(n)
